website_summaries.verdict: The Altra Torin 3.0 has certainly acquired many fans worldwide through its remarkable cushioning and firm grip both inside and outside the shoe. It was deemed excellent on inclines and the asphalt; however, based on the users’ experiences, the pair can use an improvement to the design of its forefoot region.
pros: The customers believed that the Altra Torin 3.0 provided the ‘right’ kind and amount of cushioning
it was neither too squishy nor insufficient
Many testers confirmed that the shoe stayed in a good condition, even after many miles of running
The majority were happy with how firmly the latest version of the Torin held their feet inside the shoe, thereby preventing wobbling during the running session
A few people decided to get extra pairs of the Torin 3.0 since its cushioning system helped speed up recovery from injuries
A runner was satisfied with how this shoe assisted in maintaining the natural running pattern
A user described the experience in these lightweight shoes as ‘walking on clouds’
cons: Most testers complained about the blisters they had due to the shoe’s apparently narrow toe box
A few runners mentioned that the shoe’s outsole started to come off after only several miles of running
One user talked about its upper not being breathable enough to allow a cool and dry experience throughout the day
Another individual wasn’t able to feel the much sought-after ‘springiness’ in these shoes

customer_reviews.title: Altra....if a could i would ask for my money back.
customer_reviews.text: I am split on how I feel about these shoes, am a first time user of Altra and was very excited to try them, based on all the reviews and endorsements. The shoes are very comfortable,however the quality of the build and material is very disappointing, specially given the price. I have been on two walks (adjusting to the zerodrop) and one very short run, and notice extensive wear on the shoes' bottom. I have been a runner for over 30 years and I heave never seen wear on any of my shoes like this. Kind of makes u want to ask, did they even test their product for durability? while also question the rest of their product line
customer_reviews.author: Runner4ever

customer_reviews.title: Better than the 2.0
customer_reviews.text: The Torin 2.0 was my favorite Altra shoe for distance running. I was a little disappointed in the Torin 2.5 but Altra came back in a big way with the 3.0. The 3.0 is even better than the 2.0. I immediately fell in love with the 3.0 when I put them on. Fit is the same as the 2.0
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A.

customer_reviews.title: I usually get EEE shoes or wider and these are the best shoes I have found for accommodating my wide feet
customer_reviews.text: If you have wide feet you need to try Altra shoes. I have had 5 pairs so far. The sizing has been a little inconsistent and sometimes they try to save money by having the shortest tongue possible to the point of being uncomfortable. I usually get EEE shoes or wider and these are the best shoes I have found for accommodating my wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: But true to form Altra has the most comfortable shoe. This shoe has eliminated my husbands foot ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to order a half size larger. But true to form Altra has the most comfortable shoe. This shoe has eliminated my husbands foot problems. Shoe is well made. He is on his forth pair over a course of many years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit snug fitting but a very nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: The press says that this is a highly cushioned shoe. I think not. Also, I wear size 10 but need a full size larger with this shoe. So, I had to return the pair I ordered (size 10.5). This is not a mark against the product. You need to know how your size changes between manufacturers and I thought going up a 1/2 size was enough. It wasn't. So, my only real gripe was that it wasn't nearly as cushioned as I thought it would be from reading product info. Therefore, I gave the shoes 4 stars. BTW ... I really liked the toe box. Liked the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this style. Durability still an issue
customer_reviews.text: [11/1/2017 update] About 2 months old and the sole on one side is already peeling off at the back. I had to clip it off. I really want to like this shoe, and it feels great when I run, but durability is below what I expect for this price. This is a completely different shoe to the previous models. Toe box is still roomy. I really like this style, and it looks more durable, vs the 2.5.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Parasram

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe....very well made...comfortable. Regarding the Altra shoes in general....I think they may have widened the toe box on several of their brands of shoes slightly. I usually order a size D width....which is Medium. Lately, I've noticed that Altra shoes seem to fit a bit loose around the toes. I've tried a couple of different shoes from Altra....both with the wider toe box. Personally, I wish they had kept the toe box as originally sold. Other than that....I love the Altra shoes....they fit well and are generally very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Bosco Bob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe, durability is concerning
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through four pairs of these in the last year. They're overall well made but the soles do tend to wear quickly. I sheer off different sections of the soles as I run/walk in them. They look a little goofy because of how wide they're cut in the forefoot so if you're a fashionista, keep that in mind. To me, they arent meant to look good, they're meant to be functional and they fit that to a tee. If you prefer a more natural zero drop feel to your shoes, you cant do much better than Altra's.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great true running shoe with zero heel drop (like humans have always ran)
customer_reviews.text: Great true running shoe with zero heel drop. Was getting runners knee and general knee pain running trails and road. Did an ultramarathon and started doing more research. I used to have shoes with 8 to 12mm heel drop like 95%of all shoes, which cause more heel striking. Switched to the zero drop Altras(got there trail shoes too, Altria Lone Peak 4) and have zero knee or joint pain, my calves were a little sore in the beginning but feel great now. Humans ran without that extra heel lift for thousand of years and is way more natural than a shoe with heel lift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... have wide feet and this is these are the best shoes I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and these are the best shoes I have ever purchased. This is my 4th pair from this manufacturer since I found them while travelling abroad. 2nd of the same identical design because I left the first pair in the sauna and it fell apart (my fault). I used to wear the normal brands that find in the malls like Sketchers, New Balance, etc.....Other than Sketchers, It was very hard to find WIDE shoes in the normal brands. Altra is the best that I have found so far and I am no spring chicken.
customer_reviews.author: The Man

customer_reviews.title: I loved the Torin 2
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Torin 2.5, however, the Torin 3.0 didn't feel as comfortable. The 3.0 felt too snug. I don't want to give up on the Torin, so I'l try ordering a half or full size larger. The 2.5 was the most comfortable shoe I've ever worn, so I'm hoping the larger size will redeem the perfect feel I had with the Torin. Update: As I've continued to run in the Torin 3.0, the shoe has seemingly adjusted to my foot, giving me the same superior comfort level that I've experienced with past Torin models. I'm changing my rating from 4 stars to 5. I love the zero drop, wide toe box and soft cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Spock

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfy Shoes Ever
customer_reviews.text: These shoes provide a great toe box area and gives your toes a great deal of comfort. The zero drop platform takes the pressure off of the front of your foot. The sole allows your foot to roll off, providing even more comfort. Primarily, I bought these shoes due to soreness in my great toe, caused by arthritis and spurs. Hallux rigitus is a condition which causes the great toe joint to become inflamed. It is sometimes referred to as "Turf toe" as well. These shoes really helped with this condition.
customer_reviews.author: F. Fazio

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn. I love the zero drop heels and roomy foot shaped toe area. I'm normally a size 11.5 wide or 12 regular for most shoe brands. For Nike and Asics I'm a 12 wide. But for this brand I'm a 12.5. My only concern at this point will be to see how long they last me. Other then that I'm sold on Altra shoes if they're all similar to this one and look forward to trying out more later. I plan on encouraging family and friends to try them too if they're interested.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used to hate running until....
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd pair of Altras, first were Timp trail runners. They run small by ~1/2 a size, but what a difference in running comfort. Read up on the "zero drop" philosophy and you'll find it makes biomechanical sense. I used to hate running, anything more than 2 miles sucked. Then I found Altras. I just completed my 1st 10 mile run ever and plan to do a 1/2 marathon in July, and I'm damn near 50. Add a pair of "Run Forever" calf compression sleeves and take on the distance!
customer_reviews.author: west valton archer

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality product
customer_reviews.text: I always liked Altra shoe, but the one I got doesnt has the same quality. The tongue of the shoe came of after a month of usage. I'm deeply disappointed with this I ran just 70 miles in these shoes. Update: Rating from 1 to 5. Altra Customer Service gave me a new pair of new Torin. I'm very impressed with Altra brand
customer_reviews.author: Khushbu Mor

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These shoes may look a bit odd, but believe me. You're not going to care once you try them. They feel almost like wearing pillows on your feet! I have flat feet and I can run all day in these with no foot pain. Others have commented on how these run a bit small, but they were pretty "true to size" for me. I just hope Altra never changes their shoes because if they don't, they have a customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Gummert

customer_reviews.title: OK but not for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for a swollen toe alternated wear cycle to deal with the pain. Clark leather shoes (or expensive leather shoes) or larger boots are a better choice. See my other posts for problem toe solutions. For less money and better sizing this may have worked. The heel side width was snug bur comfortable. The toe needed more room. I bought them oversize and the toe still to painful on my swollen toe and sporty socks.
customer_reviews.author: WolfKeep

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Runners
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet, and had Morton's Neuromas. Prior to surgery, these were the only shoes that made it possible for me to work and run at the gym. Toe box is wide enough for metatarsals to splay. I just wish that they would design a pair where the heel coverage is taller/deeper for those that need to add extra insoles for those with common foot ailments. When you add an insole, it makes your heel come partially out of the heel portion and irritates the skin.
customer_reviews.author: puggyroo

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Well cushioned. About one size smaller than the label. Pricing changes with size, too. Thick forefoot cushion was more important to me than zero-drop, but these tend to go together. A little awkward with lateral motion or uneven ground, but that's a road running shoe for you. Appears to be durable, but still pretty low mileage so far. Lightweight, don't feel as natural as the Escalantes, but don't dig at your instep as much either. Remember to adjust gradually to zero-drop running. Update : Served me well for about 350 miles. Sole has lost a little cushion, and holes appeared quickly in the upper. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Publius

customer_reviews.title: Altras are amazingly comfortable shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Altras are amazing shoes. Large toe box is awesome as is the fit and comfort. Love these shoes. Probably my 4th pair of Altras. Zero drop shoes can cause some achilles fatigue, so make sure you are aware that these are zero drop(flat) shoes. Your heels are at the same level as your toes, just like if you were barefoot. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: CRS

customer_reviews.title: Altra Torin
customer_reviews.text: This particular pair of Altra Torin (size 12 mens) was a gift for my son. He likes the shoe. I previously bought a slightly larger size for myself that I am using exclusively for my treadmill and floor routines at Anytime Fitness. It features a nice wide toebox with a reasonable amount of cushioning, while being light weight and somewhat flexible with soft porous uppers.
customer_reviews.author: Allan H.

customer_reviews.title: The Torin 3 is a nice upgrade. Overall an excellent running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Been running in Altras for a couple of years now. The Torin 3 is a nice upgrade. Overall an excellent running shoe. Transitioned from Ascics to Altra and was very happy with the switch. I credit this shoe with eleviating my plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: BigMike56

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around shoe
customer_reviews.text: It feels a little smaller in the toe box than my Lone Peak 2.5 in the same size. Maybe slightly smaller overall as well, but only very slightly. Overall I'm very satisfied with the shoe, it feels cushioned but not sloppy. I'm only into them 30 miles or so but I'm loving them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully comfortable runner/daily wearer
customer_reviews.text: Probably the most comfortable shoe I've ever worn. I have already gotten used to zero-drop shoes from another pair of Altras, so I didn't have an adjustment period to wearing these. I use them for road running as well as walking (and sometimes work if I have a long day of standing on hard surfaces). These are soft-soled, comfortable, and light weight. They run true to size with a huge toe box. The heel cup is stiffer than Altra Superiors, but it doesn't dig into my foot at all. There is almost no arch support, which is fine for my low arches.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Staschiak

customer_reviews.title: Worth trying if you want go with zero drop shoes
customer_reviews.text: I had Torin 2's before this pair, and while the design has changed the bit they still fit well and run great. Only complaint is the laces are pretty short and hard to double knot (which is must when I run).
customer_reviews.author: Jason A

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: I like the theory behind this shoe but not sure it helps any. My son ran cross country over the summer and even though he logged several miles I expect a more durable shoe for the money. He began in late May and by July 4th the shoes were toast. He did run twice a day which usually amounted to 10-12 miles per day 6 days a week. That may sound like a lot of miles but as he progresses to varsity he will run even more. The Saucony shoes we bought afterward have held up much better and were no more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: TBrow

customer_reviews.title: Buy .5 size up
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted these to work but after the first run the fit felt different. Walking the the house they seemed the right size but after 4 miles I could feel my middle toes start touching. After walking around one more day they were obviously too small. I couldn't tell until the soles were scraped up from the road.
customer_reviews.author: NWW

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of shoes. I have been an Altra fan for a few years now. Started out wearing the Instinct model and now I moved onto the Torin. Torin much more comfortable for me, nice cushion and keeps my feet from hurting. They do start peeling at the bottom a little bit, but does not bother me, I wear them till they fall off my feet in pieces.
customer_reviews.author: joeyD

customer_reviews.title: Not so durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe last year and meant to review it then because it failed so quickly but I got sidetracked. Better late than never, though. It's an otherwise fine shoe, comfortable, well padded, but the fabric at the heel is very flimsy. This hole in the picture represents less than three weeks of serious wear after the initial purchase. I have since only used the shoe sporadically for just kickin' around now and then, no training, but got them out today for a stroll. Walked an hour in them and got a blister for my trouble. As I said, comfy shoe, just no durability whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: North Wind

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for an average runner
customer_reviews.text: I run about 5-7 miles a week, 2-3 days a week. I’m not training for anything more than to be able to run a 5k without jogging someday. The shoes have a nice wide toe box and remind me to keep my form even when getting tired/lazy due to the zero drop. Plenty of cushion but not a max cushion like the Paradigm. I’ll buy another pair in 9 months or so if they are on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Orville Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: ... first experience with zero drop shoes and overall I like them. I walk up to 10 miles a ...
customer_reviews.text: These have been my first experience with zero drop shoes and overall I like them. I walk up to 10 miles a day for my job as a mail carrier and I started getting tendonitis in my knees due to overworking. These shoes have a very cushioned sole which makes them comfortable and the zero drop seems to place less pressure on my knee. Negatives are that a small section of the sole started to peel off so I superglued it down and it has been fine. I also have developed a corn callous on my forefoot due to the added pressure on that part of the foot. Still better than knee pain though.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe...hate that they don't last very long
customer_reviews.text: This will be my 3rd pair of Torins...all three have failed in the same spot of the mesh upper. and the soles do wear a bit premature as well...Most comfortable pair of shoes I've yet to wear...would love to get more than 4 months of wear out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Bond

customer_reviews.title: Toes ahoy!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a shoe that can grip the middle of my foot while leaving room for the toes. A definite bloody-toe-reducer on 100+ mile runs. Well-cushioned, but not over the top, while maintaining a fairly small rise: good for mid- to front-foot runners, not so much for heel runners.
customer_reviews.author: Honey Badger

customer_reviews.title: This is a great choice if you like and need substantial cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Free your feet. This is a great choice if you like and need substantial cushioning. I really enjoy these and they are the second pair I've bought. If you've considered trying this new style of footwear and want a cushioned sneaker, give these a go. I don't think you'll be disappointed. Just remember, to give them a couple days of wearing around the house before you decide you don't like them, if you're trying Altras for the first time. It's a different sensation for your feet to actually be able to have your toes spread out and relax. Perfect shoes for wider feet also.
customer_reviews.author: Analytical Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Best running, work, and walking shoes I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 pairs of Altras and I absolutely love them. I keep 2 pair at the hospital where I work. They’re great for walking or standing all day on concrete, they’re way better than Berkenstock. I have a pair to run on the road and treadmills and a pair of Lone Peaks for trails. I’ll never buy a different brand of shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe with lots of cushioning.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! The stack height is exactly what I was looking for-cushion is perfect. The foot box is wide open and very comfortable, I did order a size up and glad I did-easy recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Pair - Excellent as always
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my 3rd pair of these. I get nervous when shoes iterate models and they say ‘new and improved’ because sometImes they ‘new and improve’ what was great about them right out of the product.. but not these. All the good remains and I picked up right where I left off with my prior pair. These are comfortable right out the box!
customer_reviews.author: D. Heinkel

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable/sole wears out quickly
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit great for wide feet, but the sole is not rubber and the foam wears out quickly. For the $$ spent I would've expected them to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Squeeze middle of foot.  Very slippery on wet smooth surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning these because we had rain on my 2nd day of wearing them and they were very slippery on smooth wet surfaces compared to all my other shoes. An additional problem is something that does not bother everyone - I don't like shoes where the cushioning is always squeezing my foot when I'm just wearing the shoes casually. That actually feels nice initially, but after a few hours my feet are screaming to escape. It does not bother me for running and hiking, but when I stop it's trouble, so the shoes are only usable when active for me, and I prefer shoes that are good for all round use.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Peavy

customer_reviews.title: Good for long training runs...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe overall. I have been running in the Altra Escalante and still prefer the Escalante for race day. However, for a long training run, this is a good choice. The cushioning feels good and keeps you rolling on the long runs.
customer_reviews.author: dbeth33

customer_reviews.title: Squeak squeak squeak
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are comfortable and I liked them for the first 1 month then they began to squeak. Both shoes squeak with every step. I'm upset that i can't return at this point. I've owned maybe 10 pairs of Altra's and none have ever done this before.
customer_reviews.author: K. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: These are the most comfortable shoes I have ever run in
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness kanye lost his mind and made me boycott adidas. These are the most comfortable shoes I have ever run in. I am a big guy 270lbs and these are the best running shoes I have ever tried. Great on the road and amazing on treadmill, feels like running on a trampoline.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: Love this model there perfect fit and true to size the toe box allows toes to splay i was able to run with no aches or achiles issues
customer_reviews.author: Shawnsaleo

customer_reviews.title: Fits the natural shape of you foot
customer_reviews.text: Imagine a foot-shaped shoe that is actually designed to fit your feet and not pinch your toes like so many silly brands do. I've said good-bye to plantar fascitis thanks to the Altra Torin.
customer_reviews.author: Canyon Country Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes !!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite shoes. I’m not a runner, but these are great everyday shoes. They are light and my toes DO NOT feel cramped. I like them so much, I just bought a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: DWMP

customer_reviews.title: Altra nailed a perfect fit and function with the new Torin
customer_reviews.text: Altra nailed a perfect fit and function with the new Torin. I couldn't be happier with how these feel on my feet. I am looking forward to some long, comfortable runs. Also, the seller provided excellent customer service, and the package even arrived a day earlier than I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: The Altra Torin 3's are perfect! The wide toe box accommodates my bunion and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunion and run with the Chi Running style. The Altra Torin 3's are perfect! The wide toe box accommodates my bunion and zero drop supports Chi Running!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit odd look
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe but have to get use to the look of it. It has plenty of room for my toes and they don't get squashed like other shoes. They look like orthopedic shoes thou but feel great so I focus on function not appearance.
customer_reviews.author: phammond

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so light and have great heel support. I have plantar fasciitis and these are the first running shoes that help me not feel the pain. Great fit and good look.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: I love them. I've worked out a few times in ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after wearing the 2.5 for a couple of months. So far, I love them. I've worked out a few times in them already and it feels like I'm walking on a cloud. Could not recommend these enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: New heel material?
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these that I bought in May that I loved. Ordered the same exact shoe, the same exact size, walked a couple miles in then to break them in, and got a pretty sizable blister on my right heel. Left foot is fine. Not sure what the deal is but the back of the right shoe isn’t as pliable for some reason and rubbed the back of my heel raw.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Williams

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky!!
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are very comfortable and fit great, but they squeak bad! After a day of walking on pavement they started squeaking. It’s both right and left and it doesn’t stop! I have tried wearing them on different surfaces, but any hard surface they squeak. After trying for a few weeks a hoping it would go away I finally had to put them away and put in a different pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Collins

customer_reviews.title: Preferred zero-drop running shoe with great cushioning
customer_reviews.text: I like the wide, foot-shaped toe box. I’ve run in a lot of different styles over the years from ASICS to Brooks and even Newtons. I gradually worked my way down to a zero-drop shoe like this one. I first tried Altras a few years ago, but I really prefer the cushioning level in the Torin more than the rest. This truly has become my preferred/primary running shoe... lightweight, neutral, yet good cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for long runs. Needed one size larger than normal.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10.5US size normally. But for this pair, I ordered size 11 and it fits perfectly. I go on long runs and the cushion is a blessing. I am not getting any blisters which I was getting previously in other shoes. I also did a 10 hour hike at Yosemite National Forest and this pair of shoes stood its test. I have been using this pair since one week and I am extremely satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Arnab Paul

customer_reviews.title: I like these just as much as the Torin 2
customer_reviews.text: I like these just as much as the Torin 2.0's they replaced. Nice roomy toe box, Tongue stays in place. Very comfortable across my high arch/instep.
customer_reviews.author: Mapman

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoe ever
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the most comfortable shoe that I have ever owned. I will buy more shoes from Altra in the future. I don't think I will wear any other brand from this point on.
customer_reviews.author: James Battles

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable and helps you walk or run better
customer_reviews.text: Jumped from Torin 2.0 to the 3.0. Love them as much. Fit and feel are great. Knees and back have done much better with Torin. Only weakness is the heel backing. Wears down way too fast. I’m going to try some moleskin on the shoe to hopefully prevent it from happening on these. I recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Td

customer_reviews.title: they were comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits as expected. Although I have the Altra Escalante which I do wear a size 8. So Initially I ordered the size 8 but needed the 8.5 for the Torin 3.0. The shoe itself has some decent cusioning in the forefoot. I ran in them on a 5k practice run, they were comfortable right out of the box. Great everyday training shoe.
customer_reviews.author: WestRiverGang

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for hard to fit feet.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of this model I have purchased. I have feet that are hard on shoes (or vice versatility) and these have done the best. I bought these because I had worn out the tread on the sole and a hole in the upper, so it was about time to change.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em!
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair of this shoes. I love this model. I can get around 400 miles out of them as long as I do nothing but run in them. My only complaint is I hate the semi-stretchy flat laces.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Carlson

customer_reviews.title: I've got about 140 miles on these so far and they are holding up great.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is exactly what I needed--something with a little more cushioning for the long runs but not so soft that it lacks stability and support. Will definitely buy this model again when I wear these out. I've got about 140 miles on these so far and they are holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Whitcher

customer_reviews.title: Feel great to run in
customer_reviews.text: Feel great to run in, very soft and cushioned. I'm a little concerned the front outside part of soles won't hold up as it's a softer material, not the rubber that's on the other high impact parts of the sole. After only a few runs they're already displaying significant wear. But, my concerns may be unwarranted. Have enjoyed every run in them so far.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: not a bad thing. Good shoes to rotate into your run
customer_reviews.text: Sure-footed barefoot feel is a plus. Does seem to need just a little more cushioning. Will stretch ham string and upper calf muscle.....not a bad thing. Good shoes to rotate into your run.
customer_reviews.author: frank a jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe with lots of cushioning and comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe with lots of cushioning and comfort. Size runs about a half-to-full size small, which has been my general experience with Altra shoes. This is my sixth pair of Altra shoes and I am sold on them. I ordered the next size up from my normal shoe size and they were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ronna

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for those who like cushion and zero drop
customer_reviews.text: Runs small, but very comfortable. "Squishy" cushion feel, roomy toe box. They will wear down quicker than other, more firm shoes, but so worth it because of the comfort and ride in these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: feels great.
customer_reviews.text: The normal, after the third run, the shoe started to rub off. that been said, feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed A.

customer_reviews.title: Width is great. Been running with these for six weeks and ...
customer_reviews.text: Toe Box is a little tight height-wise. Width is great. Been running with these for six weeks and so far, so good. Give yourself a little time to break them in due to the Zero-Drop. Very satisfied thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Black

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes-good quality
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 size small for me. Usually fits 10 M for all other brands Maybe consider buying 1/2 larger than usual size.
customer_reviews.author: bpk

customer_reviews.title: I love the funky look but it works great
customer_reviews.text: I love the funky look but it works great . I used to damage my toenails running with other sneakers but that has all stopped using the Torin . Just after a few runs they are broken in and fit and feel great I’ll never buy anything else but Altra sneakers
customer_reviews.author: 2BH

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet in this great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have put around 40 miles in the shoes and I am really happy and surprised of the shoes fit and how comfortable they are. They are fast, comfortable and do the job as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto M.

customer_reviews.title: very airy shoe that dries super fast if they get wet
customer_reviews.text: comfy shoe. very wide forefoot however, there is a ton of flex in the upper if you walk on off cambers. very airy shoe that dries super fast if they get wet.
customer_reviews.author: C.W.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: A littles less cushion than Hoka's, better foot flex with support than Nike Free RN's, and better feel and support than Asics. I wear Nike 10.5, Asics 10, Adidias 9.5... Altra 10's fit perfect. My toes are now FREE!
customer_reviews.author: fightingmink

customer_reviews.title: Love my Altras
customer_reviews.text: Love Altra shoes. I won't run in anything else. These are light and have adequate cushioning. They do run small so I always order one full size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. Love the wide toe box and the zero drop. This model has exceptional cushioning. Much superior to Hoka OneOne, a pair of which I just returned.
customer_reviews.author: Gruber

customer_reviews.title: Running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Altra makes an excellent shoe, but they are not for everyone. I recommend trying a pair from you local running store. If you like them, then order subsequent pairs from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Comfy.
customer_reviews.text: I bit larger in the front compared to other styles by this maker, but the cushioning is much better for older folks with less natural padding.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Baker

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable shoe I have ever owned. The widest toe box ever. I get full toe splay when walking. Very light weight also. I cant tell I have them on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Only brand and style I buy now for work.
customer_reviews.author: M Powers

customer_reviews.title: Run comfortably
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the shoes. Everything is as expected; zero drop, nicely cushioned, good traction, toe room, fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Thitipong

customer_reviews.title: Fifth pair... and when these wear out I'll buy some more!
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth pair of Torins. They work well for me as a casual runner.
customer_reviews.author: Ankenoid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Wide toebox. Excellent for wide feet, especially if you have Morton`s neuroma
customer_reviews.author: G Perez

customer_reviews.title: Love my runs in these
customer_reviews.text: I almost went with what some other people have said and ordered a size up. I'm glad I didn't. These fit true to size. I love the fit, and I love the feel. They are very soft, yet have some spring. Very lightweight, and I agree that the uppers have some good breathability. I love this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hillis

customer_reviews.title: My boyfriend loves the shoe. He bought the size ...
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend loves the shoe. He bought the size 9.5. He always gets a half size larger in athletic shoes to allow for swelling.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIE C

customer_reviews.title: LARGER TOE BOX AND ZERO GRAVITY GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Helps with tight achilles and wider foot. Womens shoes still too narrow so i had to buy mens
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Lauder

customer_reviews.title: ... the sizing recommendations on the Altra website and am glad I did so
customer_reviews.text: I followed the sizing recommendations on the Altra website and am glad I did so. Ordering 1/2 size larger than normal for this shoe was perfect. After the first few weeks of regular use they have met all expectations. They are very comfortable as I alternate between walking and running during my workouts.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the box toe, no more pain from getting my toes squashed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Fugleberg

customer_reviews.title: The zero drop design of these shoes was the reason ...
customer_reviews.text: The zero drop design of these shoes was the reason for my purchase. I was looking for a shoe that was purpose built for a more natural running style. First run impressions were very positive. They will take some time to get used to but I found them to be well designed and built.
customer_reviews.author: Delta385

customer_reviews.title: Clown shoes
customer_reviews.text: I never gave these shoes a chance for to run in. Felt and looked like I was wearing clown shoes. I wouldn't be caught dead wearing something so hideous on my feet
customer_reviews.author: Incos

customer_reviews.title: Beyond comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boyfriend and he loves them. It's his second pair and he wears nothing else. He talks about how comfortable they are, and the wideness of the shoe is perfect. He recommends everyone to get a pair of these shoes. He's even trying to convince me since I'm pregnant. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love the toe space, most shoes for me feel really narrow up front. Good cushioning on pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of this shoe, I usually wear an 11 but for these I needed an 11.5. I have awful knees and these shoes are the best. I tried other shoes and they just killed my knees. Witt these I can run no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse S.

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable. I read other reviews and ordered a size ...
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable. I read other reviews and ordered a size up which was perfect. I haven’t had them long enough to know the quality. I love the shape of the toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe B

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Easily, the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever worn. I have really flat feet and these are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These have got to be the most comfortable shoe right out of the box I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: scott a coons

customer_reviews.title: Light but fully cushioned
customer_reviews.text: I'm an overweight walker and these are some of the most comfortable shoes I've used to do my 5 mile daily walk in.
customer_reviews.author: 22 Utah Snow

customer_reviews.title: my podiatrist recommended these and I haven’t stopped running since
customer_reviews.text: Most shoes I am a 10 or 10 1/2 but in altras I am an 11, this is my 4 th pair and I won’t run in any other shoes, I am an avid runner and because of foot pain I thought I was going to be done. Not the case, my podiatrist recommended these and I haven’t stopped running since!
customer_reviews.author: jordanbogart

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Decent shoes. My first zero drop. Very cushioned. Rubber on the bottom is peeling after first two runs.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: My second pair...great shoe for me....especially if you want a wide toe box...
customer_reviews.author: rtjackucla

customer_reviews.title: Great long distance running shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of Altra's, and they fit exactly as I expected them to and are great for running long distance. I had no break in period with these and have been running a few miles in them with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe for runners suffering from plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a size up because my husband takes a 1/2 size and we heard they run small...perfect fit. Very comfortable running shoe. Extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ALTRA Men's Torin 3 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: We've taken your favorite Altra road shoe and added increased breathability in the upper for enhanced comfort during your run, as well as an updated FootPod outsole that better maps the bones and tendons of your feet for natural flexibility. Otherwise the Torin 3.0 keeps that same soft, responsive, lightweight feel of A-Bound Cushioning, a FootShape toe box, and Zero Drop platform to encourage natural running form and happy toes.
feature_bullets: DESIGNED TO IMPROVE: Natural Foot Positioning, Toe Splay, Comfort
PLATFORM: Fully cushioned Zero Drop platform with FootShape toe box. CUSHIONING: Medium. STACK HEIGHT: 28mm. LAST: PFS2-M.
MIDSOLE: EVA with A-Bound top layer and InnerFlex. OUTSOLE: FootPod outsole. INSOLE: 6mm Contour Footbed. UPPER: Quick-Dry Air Mesh.
IDEAL USES: Running, Walking, Fitness, Cross-Training. WEIGHT: 8.4oz./238g.
